standards.description: Interpret products of whole numbers
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Interpret products of whole numbers, e.g., interpret 5 x 7 as the total number of objects in 5 groups of 7 objects each.

standards.description: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts; understand a fraction a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.

standards.description: Multiply a whole number of up to four digits by a one-digit whole number
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Multiply a whole number of up to four digits by a one-digit whole number, and multiply two two-digit numbers, using strategies based on place value and the properties of operations.

standards.description: Recognize volume as an attribute of solid figures and understand concepts of volume measurement
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Recognize volume as an attribute of solid figures and understand concepts of volume measurement.

standards.description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

standards.description: Use variables to represent quantities in a real-world or mathematical problem
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Use variables to represent quantities in a real-world or mathematical problem, and construct simple equations and inequalities to solve problems.

standards.description: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Understand that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output. The graph of a function is the set of ordered pairs consisting of an input and the corresponding output.

standards.description: Solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable, including equations with coefficients represented by letters.

standards.description: Ask and answer questions referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Ask and answer questions, and make relevant connections, to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

standards.description: Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Determine two or more main ideas of a text and explain how they are supported by key details; summarize the text.

standards.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

standards.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

standards.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient.

standards.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas, concepts, and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

standards.description: Analyze and interpret data to provide evidence that plants and animals have traits inherited from parents
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Analyze and interpret data to provide evidence that plants and animals have traits inherited from parents and that variation of these traits exists in a group of similar organisms.

standards.description: Make observations to provide evidence that energy can be transferred from place to place
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Make observations to provide evidence that energy can be transferred from place to place by sound, light, heat, and electric currents.

standards.description: Develop a model using an example to describe ways the geosphere, biosphere, hydrosphere, and atmosphere interact
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Develop a model using an example to describe ways the geosphere, biosphere, hydrosphere, and/or atmosphere interact.

standards.description: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact to determine if a chemical reaction has occurred.

standards.description: Use argument supported by evidence for how the body is a system of interacting subsystems
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Use argument supported by evidence for how the body is a system of interacting subsystems composed of groups of cells.

standards.description: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence from rock strata for how the geologic time scale is used
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence from rock strata for how the geologic time scale is used to organize Earth's 4.6-billion-year-old history.

standards.description: Use the periodic table as a model to predict the relative properties of elements
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Use the periodic table as a model to predict the relative properties of elements based on the patterns of electrons in the outermost energy level of atoms.

standards.description: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how the structure of DNA determines the structure of proteins
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how the structure of DNA determines the structure of proteins, which carry out the essential functions of life through systems of specialized cells.

standards.description: Explain how the availability of resources affects people differently in different regions
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Explain how the availability of natural resources, climate conditions, and the geography of a region affect the way people live in that region.

standards.description: Compare and contrast forms of governance, belief systems, and family structures among African, European, and Native American groups
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Compare and contrast forms of governance, belief systems, and family structures among African, European, and Native American groups.

standards.description: Analyze the impact of the American Revolution on the political structure and economic systems
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Analyze the impact of the American Revolution on the development of American politics, including new political institutions and the development of political thought.

standards.description: Explain how British colonial policies regarding Native Americans led to conflict
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Explain how British colonial policies regarding taxation and western expansion led to the American Revolution.

standards.description: Compare and contrast the access to resources and development of different civilizations
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Compare and contrast the access to, and the development of, resources in different world civilizations and the impact these had on the development of those civilizations.

standards.description: Count to 100 by ones and by tens
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Count to 100 by ones and by tens.

standards.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

standards.description: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Plan and conduct an investigation to describe and classify different kinds of materials by their observable properties.
